relation: Who doesn't love saving money? By attending PVCC, you're saving so much money. Universities charge way too much for college and this way, you're able to be in a classroom with a better student to professor ratio, increasing your chances at getting help in class.
The best thing you can do is stay focused in class but then after, meet up with some friends and relax in the library in between classes. Also, attending sports games are very fun!
There is a cute little Starbucks coffee shop in the math building that is very relaxing and a great place to study. The cafeteria also isn't too bad!
There is no dorming on this campus, but if there was, I would give it a 5!
A challenging part about college is that there are so many students attending, it can get very immpersonal with the teachers. PVCC professors do a great job at trying to help the best they can.
Be sure to study for your tests and never slack on homework. Also, take advantage of the tutors and never be afraid to ask questions when needed.

I am very pleased with the professors that teach the classes at PVCC. I would recommend this college to anyone of my friends and family. I cannot wait to complete the rest of my Associates degree here!
pageTitle: Paradise Valley Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {82756=My number one tip would be to have all items needed to start classes August 18Th turned in BEFORE their deadlines, this in order to not be caught up in the stress of turning in things the day they are due, which becomes pretty stressful at this school if your put in that position. I would just keep up to date with deadlines on the schools website and by calling the school to make sure of deadline dates in case there had been changes. Don't be afraid to make sure of anything and everything!, 261515=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Campus Safety campus safety is like a life guard anything you need they will be their from jump starting your car to a lost memory chip. Greek Life haven't experienced. Clubs and Activities their are dance clubs, drama, hiking, christian, study, art anything you can really think of its here.. Great for these types of students great for young students and adults.attending a community college allows more freedom and flexibility . many students at a community colleges have kids and jobs like many at universities might, yet the flexible hours and smaller classes allow better interaction among professor's and students. Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus at pvcc their is a tradition with barbecues. every time their is a set up of clubs trying to recruit or a big announcement their will be food involved.
